text: Depressizona exorum is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Depressizonidae. It has also been placed in Scissurellidae. ==Description== ==Distribution== This species occurs in the Pacific Ocean off Easter Island. ==References== * Geiger D. 2003. Phylogenetic assessment of characters proposed for the generic classification of Recent Scissurellidae (Gastropoda : Vetigastropoda) with a description of one new genus and six new species from Easter Island and Australia. Molluscan Research 23(1): 21–83 * Geiger D.L. (2012) Monograph of the little slit shells. Volume 1. Introduction, Scissurellidae. pp. 1–728. Volume 2. Anatomidae, Larocheidae, Depressizonidae, Sutilizonidae, Temnocinclidae. pp. 729–1291. Santa Barbara Museum of Natural History Monographs Number 7 Category:Depressizonidae Category:Gastropods described in 2003
title: Depressizona exorum
